column4: hmm - i'm running ubuntu on a very slow computer (233, 48mb ram).  Where can i find some tips on speeding it up?
ditch gnome and run fluxbox (or maybe xfce)
do you have another ubuntu machine?
- is it impossible to change from Gnome to something else without the laptop connecting to the net?
- basically - at the moment ubuntu is unusable on this machine as it is so slow. is there any otehr way i can improve?
To make xmms or beep-media-player actually play things, change the audio output plugin to eSound
it can play cd's ok - is that still the right way to go?
2400 isn't 2500, find proper instructions for your card...
i was advised that the instructions would work
then ask the one who advised you that..
